description: Views Abusive Experience Report data, and gets a list of sites that have a significant number of abusive experiences.
name: abusiveexperiencereport

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

get.description: Gets a site's Abusive Experience Report summary.

name.description: Required. The name of the site whose summary to get, e.g. `sites/http%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2F`. Format: `sites/{site}`

list.description: Lists sites that are failing in the Abusive Experience Report.

abusiveStatus.description: The site's Abusive Experience Report status.

enforcementTime.description: The time at which [enforcement](https://support.google.com/webtools/answer/7538608) against the site began or will begin. Not set when the filter_status is OFF.

lastChangeTime.description: The time at which the site's status last changed.

reportUrl.description: A link to the full Abusive Experience Report for the site. Not set in ViolatingSitesResponse. Note that you must complete the [Search Console verification process](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/9008080) for the site before you can access the full report.

reviewedSite.description: The name of the reviewed site, e.g. `google.com`.

underReview.description: Whether the site is currently under review.

title: Abusive Experience Report API
